result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua J Luce was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joshua J Luce is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joshua J Luce was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
With Huber and Good Time Credit.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 3:04 pm case called. Defendant Joshua J Luce in court with attorney J. Steven Heil.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and stated on record by DA Blader.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 2.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court enters outright dismissal of Count 1. Court sentences the defendant to: 10 days WCJ, with Huber and Good Time Credit. No Credit for Time served. To begin no later than April 1, 2016. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan.  DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.
Final pre-trial on March 10, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Case called @ 1:10 p.m. Attorney J. Steven Heil in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not appear in court - Atty Heil believes he may be at work and there may have been some miscommunication as far as whether the defendant had to be present in person. Statement by DA Blader. Court will rescheduled the FPT until later this week.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
State's Motion to Impeach with Prior Convictions

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney J. Steven Heil in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Heil requests matter be put on the trial calendar.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 01:00 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 08:00 am.
Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

Case Called @ 2:02 PM: Defendant Joshua J Luce in court with attorney J. Steven Heil.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.    NGP received and entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  ADA argues as to bond request.  No objection to bond request by Atty Heil.  Status conference scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 09:20 am.
